newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippine firms sign $300 mln cement venture.
newsitem.headline: Philippine firms sign $300 mln cement venture.

text.p: Three Philippine companies said they had signed an agreement to participate in the construction of a $300 million cement plant in Cebu island.
Aboitiz Equity Ventures Inc, House of Investment Inc and Pacific Cement Co Inc told the Philippine Stock Exchange on Tuesday they have signed an agreement to form South Western Cement Corp.
On Monday, British building materials group Blue Circle Industries Plc said in London it would hold 20 percent in the joint venture and operate the project and plant.
Japan's Nissho Iwai Corporation and Philippine firm Lo-oc Limestone and Development Corp will also take equity in the project, Aboitiz said.
House of Investments said it would hold a 30 percent equity in South Western Cement while Aboitiz and Pacific Cement said they would each hold 20 percent.
The proposed plant would have a cement capacity of 1.6 million tonnes per annum.
Construction of the plant will start this year and is scheduled to be completed in 1999, House of Investments said.
